section.title: Description
section.p: The User Administration plugin allows a defined set of "administrators" to add and delete users dynamically to their blojsom installation. This means that a restart of the server is no longer required when adding or removing users from the system.

section.title: Installation and Setup
section.p: In your global plugin.properties file, add the following line:

Add the following to your /WEB-INF/web.xml file under the init-params for BlojsomServlet.
<init-param> <param-name>plugin-admin-edit-users</param-name> <param-value>/WEB-INF/plugin-admin-edit-users.properties</param-value> </init-param>

Add the following file to your /WEB-INF directory under the filename, plugin-admin-edit-users.properties.
bootstrap-directory=/bootstrap blog-home-base-directory=/change/me/please administrators=default

bootstrap-directory is the location off your /WEB-INF directory where the bootstrap properties and templates directory is. This precludes you from adding a user named "bootstrap". If you would like to add a user named "bootstrap", change the directory name here and on disk appropriately. blog-home-base-directory is the directory where users blogs will be stored. A directory with the new user id will be created under this directory for users you add dynamically to your blojsom installation. administrators is a comma-separated list of users who are enabled to add and delete users from your blojsom installation.

Copy the bootstrap directory under your /WEB-INF directory so that you have a /WEB-INF/bootstrap directory and a /WEB-INF/bootstrap/templates directory. This is the directory that contains a bootstrap set of properties files and templates for adding new users to your blojsom installation.

section.title: Usage
section.p: After logging into the administration console, you may click on the link to "Edit Blog Users" and you will be able to add and delete users.
